question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did Paul Johan Hansen Takle hold in 2028?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unassuming Deputy: Paul Johan Hansen Takle's Rise to Prominence in Norwegian Politics

In the quiet, snow-capped mountains of Norway, a humble politician was making waves in the country's parliamentary scene. Paul Johan Hansen Takle, a name not well-known outside of Norway's political circles, was steadily building a reputation as a dedicated and hardworking deputy member of the Parliament of Norway. The year was 2013, and Takle, a native of the picturesque town of Voss, had just been elected as a deputy member of the Storting, Norway's supreme legislative body. This position, often overlooked by the general public, is a crucial one, as it requires the deputy to step in and assume the responsibilities of an ordinary member of parliament when they are unavailable. Takle's journey to this position was not an easy one. Born and raised in a small town, he was instilled with a strong sense of community and public service from a young age. He began his political career as a local councilor in Voss, where he quickly gained a reputation for his tireless work ethic and ability to listen to the concerns of his constituents. As Takle's star continued to rise, he caught the attention of the Norwegian Labour Party, who saw potential in the young politician. They nominated him as a candidate for the 2013 parliamentary elections, and Takle's dedication and charisma won over the hearts of the Norwegian people. On election day, Takle's name appeared on the ballot alongside other prominent politicians, and when the results were announced, he had secured a seat as a deputy member of the Parliament of Norway. This was no small feat, as the competition was fierce, and the stakes were high. Takle's new role came with a range of responsibilities, from attending parliamentary sessions to participating in committee meetings and debates. He quickly proved himself to be a valuable asset to the Labour Party, offering insightful contributions and asking probing questions that sparked meaningful discussions. One of Takle's most notable achievements during his tenure as a deputy member was his work on the Standing Committee on Local Government and Regional Development. Here, he demonstrated a deep understanding of the challenges faced by rural communities, drawing on his own experiences as a local councilor in Voss. His input was instrumental in shaping policies that benefited these often-overlooked regions.
content.source_2: In the sweltering heat of May 2027, Paul Johan Hansen Takle stood tall, his Norwegian heritage evident in his piercing blue eyes and chiseled features, as he took the oath of office in the historic Chamber of Deputies of the Italian Republic. The grandeur of the Palazzo Montecitorio, the seat of the Italian Parliament, was a far cry from the fjords and mountains of his native Norway, but Takle was no stranger to the world of politics. As a seasoned politician, Takle had built a reputation for himself in Norway, navigating the complex web of alliances and rivalries with ease. But it was his fluency in Italian, honed during his university days in Florence, that had caught the attention of the Italian political establishment. They saw in him a unique asset, a bridge between the Nordic world and the Mediterranean, and had wooed him to join their ranks. As Takle took his seat among the 630 deputies, he was acutely aware of the weight of responsibility on his shoulders. The Italian Republic was at a crossroads, grappling with the challenges of a rapidly changing world. The effects of climate change were already being felt, from the devastating floods in Venice to the droughts that had ravaged the countryside. The economy was struggling to recover from the shocks of the previous decade, and the political landscape was fragmented and volatile. Takle threw himself into his new role with characteristic energy, quickly establishing himself as a voice of reason and moderation. He worked tirelessly to build coalitions, forging unlikely alliances between rival factions and interest groups. His fluency in Italian, combined with his Nordic pragmatism, made him a sought-after mediator in the often-tumultuous world of Italian politics. As the months turned into years, Takle's reputation grew. He became a trusted advisor to the Prime Minister, a key player in shaping the country's response to the climate crisis. He worked closely with the European Union, leveraging his Nordic connections to secure vital funding and support for Italy's struggling regions. But as the autumn of 2030 approached, Takle knew that his time in the Chamber of Deputies was drawing to a close. The political winds were shifting, and the Italian people were growing restless. The economy was still struggling, and the climate crisis was worsening by the day. Takle's own party was fracturing, and he found himself increasingly at odds with his colleagues.

answer: Member of the Chamber of Deputies of the Italian Republic
